sections.paragraph_title: Five Star Caterers – Customer Booking Form

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 1 - Questions 1-10 Complete the form below. Write NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS OR A NUMBER for each answer.

questions.text: • Customer name: Mr. (1) _________.
• Daytime telephone number:(2) _________.
• Telephone number after 5 pm: As above (if no one answers,(3) _________.)
• Number of guests: (4) _________.
• Seating Shape: (6) _________.
• Number of tables: (8) _________.

Questions 9 and 10 .
Choose the correct letter A, B or C.
9. The man decided to book
10. The man will have to pay
options: C £1500 on the day of the party

instructions.main_head_002: Complete the sentences and choose the correct letter

questions.text:
Questions 11-17
According to the speaker, when did the following happen?
Write the correct letter A, B or C next to questions 11-17.
A before 1837
B between 1837 and 1900
C after 1900

11. The East Front was added to the building: _______
12. The last big structural change was made: _______
13. The building was bombed: _______
14. The building became a palace: _______
15. The building was known as The Queen’s House: _______
16. The Houses of Parliament were destroyed by fire: _______
17. The Marble Arch was moved: _______

Questions 18-20
Complete the sentences below. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS AND/ OR A NUMBER for each answer.
• Up to (18) ___________ people attend garden parties at the palace each year.
• The garden contains more than (19) ___________ species of wild flower.
• The public can visit the nineteen (20) ___________ . in August or September.

instructions.main_head_002: Answer the questions and choose from the options.

questions.text:
Answer the questions below. Write NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS for each answer.
21. What aspect of history is it important to learn something from?
22. What do we also need to know about our ancestors?
23. Where are transferable skills useful?
24. What kind of approach to learning does social science use?

Questions 25-30
What information is provided about the following academic subjects?
Choose the correct answer from the options below and write the correct letter A-H next to each subject.

Information
A Suitable for practical learners.
B Requires a lot of reading.
C Involves quantitative analysis.
D Requires critical thinking.
E Focuses on social behavior.
F Involves cultural studies.
G Deals with environmental issues.
H Has a strong geographical focus.

25. Anthropology: _______
options: B Requires a lot of reading.
H Has a strong geographical focus.

questions.text: 26. Economics: _______
options: B Requires a lot of reading.
H Has a strong geographical focus.

questions.text: 27. Education: _______
options: B Requires a lot of reading.
H Has a strong geographical focus.

questions.text: 28. Geography: _______
options: B Requires a lot of reading.
H Has a strong geographical focus.
questions.correct_answer: H Has a strong geographical focus.

options: B Requires a lot of reading.
H Has a strong geographical focus.

questions.text: 30. Sociology and social work: _______
options: B Requires a lot of reading.
H Has a strong geographical focus.

instructions.main_head_001: SECTION 4 - Questions 31-40 Complete the notes below. Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.

questions.text:
Choose the correct letter A, B or C.
31. Students should complete their work on the 1950s
options: A if they want to be allowed to continue attending lectures
B because they will appreciate the information about the 1960s more
C otherwise they face the possibility of being failed for their coursework
questions.correct_answer: B because they will appreciate the information about the 1960s more

questions.text: 32. According to the lecturer, the ‘baby boom’ happened
options: A because of relaxed attitudes in the sixties
B during a time of war
C because people felt more secure
questions.correct_answer: C because people felt more secure

questions.text: 33. In the sixties the USA had 70 million
34. According to the lecturer, compared to the 1950s, the 1960s were
35. According to the lecturer, literature changed the way women
options: A over 40 were treated by society
B viewed issues of race in society
C felt about their roles in society
questions.correct_answer: C felt about their roles in society

questions.text: 36. The rate of crime in the sixties
options: B was 9 times higher than in the fifties
C was 9 times lower than in the fifties
questions.correct_answer: B was 9 times higher than in the fifties

questions.text: 37. What happened at the start of the 1960s?
options: B the introduction of the internet

questions.text:
Questions 38-40
Complete the summary below. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS for each answer.
In October, 1962, US President Kennedy met advisers to discuss (38)__________ which proved that the Cubans were installing nuclear missiles, presumably to use against the US.
Kennedy chose (39) __________ option, which prevented the build up of more missiles and led to the withdrawal of the existing ones.
Most are agreed that a (40) __________ was narrowly avoided by Kennedy’s decision .
